page.title: 06FAIRVIEW FARM, ALLET, TRURO.
page.content: This is a mixed beef & arable farm of 57\ acres run entirely by the middle- aged Mr.&Mrs.G.who intend to move soon to a smaller,more easily managed farm. Hay is produced as a crop, some of which is sold locally although in most seasons it is sold further afield in areas of short supply. This is done through relatives & friends in the north of England. Capital is limited, so that the owners could not consider either dairy-farming or large-scale cereal production, both of which would require considerable investment & which are, it is felt, governed by too restrictive E.E.C. rules. Cereal production would be very risky without having full drying & storage facilities, apart from the fact that there is already over-production. E.E.C.quotas would make a change to dairy-farming unviable.
